resources.string:
This is not a separate application, but rather, a package of extra tilesets to be used with the NetHack application. To use, simply install and launch the NetHack application, then use the Preferences menu to pick a tileset (and enable tiled UI mode, if needed).

The tilesets included here were made by other people, and have been made freely available online for use by the NetHack community. If you are the creator of one of these and wish for it to be removed from this package, or want to be credited differently, please contact the developer.
This tileset is included by permission from its creator, Chozo Abigaba. For more info and download, see www.multifoliate.com/nh/.
This is a variant of the Abigaba tiles, modified by K. Bailey. For more info and download, see www.multifoliate.com/nh/.

This tileset was created by John Shaw, and was originally available here: www.aesthetictech.8m.com/Absurd.htm See also nethack.wikia.com/wiki/The_Absurd_NetHack_Tileset for more information. The new home for this tileset will be www.thinktwicenews.com.

This is a slightly different version of the Absurd tileset which was found here: bilious.homelinux.org/~paxed/nethack/nhsshot/tileset/absurd32_nethack.png. The main difference I know about is that the walls are pictured straight from above, rather than at an angle.
Part of the graphic tiles used in this program is the public domain roguelike tileset \"RLTiles\". You can find the original tileset at: http://rltiles.sf.net
